block.p: Dr. Bernadette Ruzol Gochuico, a daughter of Dr. Norma R. Gochuico of Merrick, N.Y., and the late Dr. Ramon G. Gochuico, was married yesterday to Michael Ding Zuo, the son of Yulan Wang and Zheng Zuo of Shenzhen, China. The Rev. Robert A. Romeo, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Church of the Cure of Ars in Merrick.

The bride, 34, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a researcher in pulmonary critical-care medicine at the National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute in Bethesda, Md. She graduated magna cum laude from Boston University, from which she also received a medical degree. Her mother is an attending psychiatrist at the Kingsboro Psychiatric Center in Brooklyn. The bride's father, an internist, practices in Brooklyn.

Dr. Bernadette Ruzol Gochuico, a daughter of Dr. Norma R. Gochuico of Merrick, N.Y., and the late Dr. Ramon G. Gochuico, was married yesterday to Michael Ding Zuo, the son of Yulan Wang and Zheng Zuo of Shenzhen, China. The Rev. Robert A. Romeo, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Church of the Cure of Ars in Merrick.

The bride, 34, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a researcher in pulmonary critical-care medicine at the National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute in Bethesda, Md. She graduated magna cum laude from Boston University, from which she also received a medical degree. Her mother is an attending psychiatrist at the Kingsboro Psychiatric Center in Brooklyn. The bride's father, an internist, practices in Brooklyn.

The bridegroom, also 34, is a regional sales manager in Herndon, Va., for International Computer Graphics, computer peripheral distributors. He graduated from Xi'an Jiaotong University in Xi'an, China. He received an M.B.A. degree from Radford University in Virginia. His parents, now retired, worked for the Guangdong Nuclear Investment Company, a power station in Shenzhen, where his mother was an economist for the human resources department and his father was a senior engineer.
